data.name: Umeda Sky Building
data.desc: It is one of the 'City of Air' projects for developing Osaka attractions, symbolizing Osaka's aspirations for the future. The 40-storey two-phase tower is connected to the top and the roof garden gazebo is famous. 360 degree panoramic view is proud, and at night, many LED floors decorate beautiful scenery. The escalator connecting the observation deck is breathtakingly connected to the air, so it is also fun to ride. Underground is an underground market that reproduces the atmosphere of Osaka in the early 20th century. The first floor of the tower has a promenade and a water garden.
data.time: Observation Deck: 10:00 ~ 22:30. Artificial Garden Nakashizenomori: 10:00 ~ 21:00. Restaurant 11:00 to 22:00 (varies from restaurant to restaurant)
data.way: Get off at Umeda Station on the Midosuji Line.

data.name: Osaka Station City
data.desc: It is a railway station of JR Nishi-Nihon and it is not only Kita but also a representative shopping center of northern part of Osaka. There are South Gate Building and North Gate Building centering on JR Osaka Station, and department stores are in each building. There are various theme plazas throughout the building, making it a perfect place to use as a relaxing space.
data.way: Get off at Umeda Station on the Midosuji Line. Or just in front of JR Osaka Station.

data.name: Hankyu Department Store
data.desc: It is called pronoun of high-class department store in western Japan. It is a grand department store with two floors underground and 13 floors above ground, with an operating area of 84,000 square meters. There is a free open observation deck.
data.way: Connecting to Umeda Station and the basement of the Midosuji Line.

data.name: Hanshin Department Store
data.desc: Compared to Hankyu, Hanshin Department Store is a popular department store. It has strengths in food stores.
data.way: Get off at Midosuji Line Umeda Station.

data.name: HEP FIVE
data.desc: There is a huge Ferris wheel on the roof. HEP stands for Hankyu Entetainmnt Park. It is a place where you can enjoy large department stores and entertainment facilities together. Department stores mainly deal with casual and semi-formal wear for 20s. A large Ferris wheel can be reached on the 7th floor, and it takes about 15 minutes to see not only Osaka but also far away Kobe. On the 8th and 9th floors, there is the game center Joypolis which is operated by Sega.
data.way: Get off at Umeda Station on the Midosuji Line.
data.fee: [Ferris wheel]: ¥ 500. [Joypolis]: Free pass ¥ 2,200, attraction three times ¥ 1,400, attraction five times ¥ 2,100, including ferris wheel Free ticket (after 17:00) ¥ 1,800

data.name: National Museum of International Art
data.desc: Is famous for white pipe objects. It is said that it contains the meaning of hoping that the contemporary art will develop more like the vitality of the bamboo. He has about 7,000 works by Japanese writers, Picasso, Cezanne, and Miro.
data.time: Tue - Thu, Sun 10:00 ~ 17:00. Friday 10:00 to 19:00. Closed on Mondays.
data.way: Get off at Yotsubashi Line Higobashi Station.
data.fee: ¥ 430. College student ¥ 130, Free for high school students or younger

data.name: Osaka City Central Republican
data.desc: It is used as cultural art space such as performance and graduation ceremony. It is a public building that the son of a money changer, Ainosuke, donated 1 million yen in 1918. He was impressed by the donations of the rich people of the United States and was building the building. Before the building was completed, he was in trouble. He refused to accept the recommendation of surrounding people to donate, and he committed suicide.
data.way: Get off at Yodoyabashi Station on the Midosuji Line.

data.name: Osaka City Museum of Oriental Ceramics
data.desc: The Kansai region, which Osaka belongs to, was a place that imported ceramics from Korea and China and accepted ceramic artisans. The Sumitomo Group which donated a lot of support to make Osaka cultural facilities donated 2,700 pieces of ceramics. It also has a separate exhibition room for ceramics in Korea.
data.way: Get off at Yodoyabashi Station on the Midosuji Line.

data.name: Instant ramen invented memorial hall
data.desc: Ramen Memorial Hall built by Nissin Group, famous for ramen. You can see the history and kinds of ramen. There are two kinds of experience activities: making your own cup noodles, decorating the materials and the surface, and making a bag called chicken noodle factory. Cup noodles can be made without reservation, but Chicken Ramen Factory has to make a separate reservation on the homepage. Participation in the experiential activities should take place before 3:30.
data.way: From Hankyu Umeda Station, take express train bound for Takarazuka and get off at Ikeda Station.

data.name: Tsuyuten Shrine
data.desc: It is an old shrine that is small but about 1,300 years old. The god of grain and the god of scholars.
data.way: Get off at Higashi Umeda Station on the Tanimachi Line.

data.name: Osaka Duck Tour
data.desc: A course where you take an amphibious bus and watch the land and river together. Osaka City Hall, Midosuji, and Osaka Prefectural Government, and goes to the Okawa River from Sakura no Miya Park, a famous place for cherry blossoms. It takes about 90 minutes.
data.way: Get off at Tenmabashi station on the Tanimachi line. Boarding house: Kawanoe Hachikenya 1F (see homepage because it is planned to change the boarding pass)
data.fee: ¥ 3,700. Elementary school students and under ¥ 2,300. [12/1 ~ 3/19] ¥ 3,400. Elementary school students and below ¥ 2,200. (Please refer to the homepage for the rate change)

data.name: Grand Front Osaka
data.desc: It is a shopping town north of JR Osaka Station. There are 266 shopping malls, restaurants, cafes, hotels and theaters. The restaurant has 'UMEIKITACELLAR', which is located on the first floor of the basement floor of Ume-Kitashin Square, 'UMEKITA DINING', which is a collection of 36 restaurants including world famous shops on the 7th to 9th floors of the South, The 'azete' concept is 'UMEKITA FLOOR' which is open until 4 o'clock in the evening.
data.way: Get off at Midosuji Line Umeda Station.

data.name: Osaka City Science Museum
data.desc: A science museum where you can experience the principles of science. First floor electricity and energy, second floor Here science !, third floor We operate with the concept of chemical and four-layer universe and discovery around us.
data.time: Tuesday - Sun 09:30 ~ 17:00. Closed on Mondays. Closed on 12/28 to 1/4.
data.way: Get off at Higobashi station on the Yotsubashi line.
data.fee: 400 for adults, 300 for college / high school students, free for junior high school students or younger.
